cui_name: Retinal dystrophy with or without macular staphyloma
reasoning: Retinal dystrophy with macular staphyloma (RDMS) caused by CFAP410 mutations is extremely rare, documented primarily through case reports from consanguineous families. Cone-rod dystrophies generally have prevalence ~1/20,000-100,000, but RDMS with macular staphyloma phenotype is significantly rarer. Estimated incidence <0.001 per 100k based on genetic population studies and case report frequency.
source: OMIM #617547 (Retinal Dystrophy with or without Macular Staphyloma)
